Job_Summary:
Collaborate with data scientists to automate and optimize our data services.
Implement and monitor data quality indicators across the entire data pipeline.
Job_Description:
Company Description

null

Job Description

What you'll do

If you are looking to use your knowledge of data development to create data services – such as user scoring or a recommendation engine – in a renowned video game company, this is the job you have been looking for.

You’ll be part of the NCSA Data Science team based in Montreal in order to deliver models and tools to engage Ubisoft players and help the marketing e-commerce and subscription teams to communicate efficiently with them.

The NCSA Data Science team is based half in Montreal, half in San Francisco, it aims at implementing internal strategies to improve large-scale communication with Ubisoft players to enrich their individual experiences. Our goal is to connect to players with meaningful communication while increasing engagement and acquisition. The team primarily focuses on creating players scores and segments to improve acquisition and retention, sending tailored content recommendation of games and merchandise, and establishing personalized communication cycles.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with data scientists to automate and optimize our data services
Automate and maintain batch pipelines that collect and process data
Partner with software engineers to deliver microservices using processed data
Implement and monitor data quality indicators across the entire data pipeline
Design and build tools that provide confidence in our data quality

Qualifications

What you bring

A degree in software engineering, computer science or related
At least 2 years of experience as a data developer or other relevant experience
Experience working with Spark
Proficiency in Python
Proficiency in Java and/or Scala
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of container technologies
Knowledge of data visualization
Knowledge of advanced analytics
Strong interest in the gaming industry
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Bilingual (French & English)

What to send our way
Your CV, highlighting your education, experience, and skills
Additional Information

Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above.

At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Job_Summary:
Carefully selecting, organizing and managing real user data.
This includes both spatial and non-spatial data.
Do you have a keen eye for detail and have a knack…
Job_Description:
About The Role

Do you have a keen eye for detail and have a knack for data analysis?

Safe Software is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to help us analyze our internal testsuite tools, reviewing and consolidating both spatial and non-spatial data, and writing scripts to batch test changes and processes. This role comes with an opportunity to grow your critical thinking skills by carefully organizing and managing real user data and to increase your level of understanding of how minute changes can have a compounded effect in testing.

About the Quality Assurance Team

Our Quality Assurance development group consists of a group of several QA team members who are responsible for continuously extending the reach of FME technology to support the evolving needs of our customers. In this role, you will focus on analyzing spatial and non-spatial data to review and consolidate testsuite test datasets for FME Engine and Performance.

What You'll Be Doing

Analyzing Safe’s in-house testsuite tool, both FME Engine and FME Performance Testsuite.
Reviewing and consolidating datasets for the testsuite. This includes both spatial and non-spatial data. For example, different geometry types (point, line, polygon, aggregate 3D, 2D surfaces), ESRI data formats, etc.
Carefully selecting, organizing and managing real user data.
Assisting with maintaining and updating tests under our testsuite framework.
Writing scripts to batch processing test changes.
Investigating how changes to datasets impact test results and identifying any discrepancies with the QA team.

Some of the technologies and testing fundamentals you will be exposed to include:

Git
Developing end-to-end tests for an Enterprise web application
Internationalization
Accessibility

Qualifications, Skills, and Competencies

Excellent written and oral communication skills
Collaborative and open to receiving and sharing ideas with the team
Good problem solving abilities and takes initiative to ask questions
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Demonstrated willingness to learn

Bonus Points

Familiarity with Geographical Information Systems (GIS) concepts, ESRI ArcGIS, Python and other scripting languages
Students who are in their 3rd+ year
Prior co-op or related experience is an asset

Job_Summary: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and experience with data literacy and experience using data from multiple data sources, with the ability to…
Job_Description:
Impact Data Analyst (26-Month Term)

INVEST OTTAWA – Finance and Corporate Services


Do you love conducting economic impact research and analysis? Do you get inspired by turning data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions? Are you interested in joining a fast-paced team? Invest Ottawa requires a qualified individual with strong analytical skills to join our fast-paced and dynamic team.


WHY THIS ROLE:

Reporting to the Director of Programs and Corporate Performance Management, the Impact Data Analyst is responsible for helping Invest Ottawa measure value creation for the entrepreneurs and firms accessing our programs and services.


Key Responsibilities

Managing data pipeline to ensure quality data is collected, stored and available for analysis and reporting
Overseeing design of surveys and survey methodologies; develop alternative approaches to data collection
Managing economic impact assessments/annual report data inputs
Working with the IT & Systems department, map data and process flows including configuring CRM inputs
Working with Systems & IT, establish and maintain data management practices to improve storage, handling and processing of corporate data
Working with stakeholders around metrics/key performance indicators definitions and interpretations; best practices
Supplying internal clients with data analysis services
Effectively communicating analysis and findings through data visualizations, documents, and the use of visualization software
Preparing data to support policy decisions and to support proposal development
Developing a strategy for collecting new datapoints and assess new data sources
Following trends and research in the innovation ecosystem and BRE and FDI


Key Competencies

Bachelor of Science degree in Data Science, Information Management, Business, Economics or related field
Equivalent work experience and/or training are acceptable
3-5 years of experience in data analytics
Experience in socioeconomic impact analysis/performance measurement considered a strong asset
Ability to work independently and take initiative, with demonstrated strong organizational and project management skills
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong knowledge/experience using Excel and processing large data files, databases
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
An interest in data management practices
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and experience with data literacy and experience using data from multiple data sources, with the ability to describe business use cases, data sources and management concepts, and analytical approaches
Knowledge and experience with applying data visualization techniques and tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau considered an asset; collect, analyze, interpret, build relationship models including databases, pivot tables and macros


Do you have some of these skills but maybe not all? We still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique application and learn more about you! At Invest Ottawa and Bayview Yards, we know that diversity, inclusion and a sense of belongingness are critical success factors for globally competitive organizations and are required to drive sustainable wealth creation and prosperity across our region. We prioritize the creation of an inclusive culture and infuse diversity into our programs, operations and governance. As an equal opportunity employer that doesn’t simply accept difference but celebrates, support and thrives because of it, we invite all qualified candidates to apply, and especially encourage those who identify as members of underrepresented groups.


Invest Ottawa and Bayview Yards are determined to provide a barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you require accommodation during any phase of the evaluation process, please contact hr@investottawa.ca to request specialized accommodation. Do know, all information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential. At Invest Ottawa and Bayview Yards, we are focused on doing better and committed to leading by example because it’s what’s best for us, our culture and our community.

Job_Summary: Professional experience with data ingestion and preparation, including very large data sets of unstructured data for Business Intelligence.
Job_Description:
Closing Date: November 30, 2020

The Data Developer, RACE21™ is responsible for ingesting, transforming, and storing clean and enriched data from a variety of sources. They ensure that data is ready for use in digital products, data science, reporting, and analytics. They will design and maintain data warehouses and data marts, and structure volumes of data.

Responsibilities:
Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
Improve data availability, acting as a liaison between source systems and Data Science and BI teams
Collect, blend, and transform data using ETL tools, database management systems, and code including SQL and Python
Implement data models and structure data in ready-for-BI consumption formats
Perform aggregation on data across various warehousing models, such as OLAP cubes and star schemas for BI purposes

Qualifications:
Computer Science degree or equivalent education and experience
Professional experience with data ingestion and preparation, including very large data sets of unstructured data for Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency in Python (especially data science packages like pandas, numpy etc) and SQL for analytics, database development, and data modelling
Experience working with one or more cloud platforms to implement data-intensive applications
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and experience on an agile team
Keen collaborator and clear communicator, responsive to service needs and operational demands
Passionate about the impact of emerging technologies and learning new skills and ideas

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Qualified applicants interested in joining a dynamic team are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter electronically.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, and zinc, as well as investments in energy assets. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.
The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck’s approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2019, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the tenth straight year, indicating that Teck’s sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world’s 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

Job_Summary:
Analyze corporate data, design and develop Business Intelligence and other data management solutions.
5+ years of experience working in a directly comparable…
Job_Description:
Data Management Developer (Contract) - (200000K2)
Description

Move, Build, Grow your career!
As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people worldwide buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions –as we transform the global used equipment market.
Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.
We’re looking for a Data Management Developer to join our team in Burnaby, BC.
This is a contractor position.
The Opportunity:
The Ritchie Brothers Auctioneers Data Management Group was established in 2012. The team collects and transforms data into intelligence assets that support strategic goals, sales objectives and marketing initiatives. Based out of our global head office in South Burnaby, BC, the Data Management Developer is a critical role within this practice.
The successful candidate will work on various Data Management initiatives, including activities such as: reviewing business requirements, analysis of corporate data, and designing, developing, and testing Business Intelligence and other data management solutions. The individual will be self-motivated and like to do various things, is a quick learner and is good with, and enjoys working with, data. A focus on delivering high-value solutions to the business should be a key driver and motivator.
In This Role, you’ll:
Work with Data Architects, Technical Leads, Product Owners, Developers/Engineers and QA:
Identify and define essential information components and develop definitions
Map reports and associated data subjects/entities to source systems and the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and Data Lake (DL)
Analyze corporate data, design and develop Business Intelligence and other data management solutions
Design and develop reporting templates, reports, and other information delivery solutions
Perform system and integration testing of the end user reports and tool functionality
Perform data validation and quality assurance
Provide day-to-day support of the EDW and DL environments, with excellent customer service to internal clients, monitor new deployments and services, escalating issues where appropriate
Proactively identify and resolve capacity and performance-related issues
Design and develop automation scripts for processes such as ETL, deployment, environment refreshes
Develop and maintain sufficient support documentation to facilitate day-to-day support of the EDW and DL environments
Plan, test, and implement enhancements to the EDW and DL environments on a regular release cycle
Assess new data management functionality and tools as appropriate and making recommendations as to their adoption

Here’s What You’ll Bring:
5+ years of experience working in a directly comparable role responsible for data warehouse and data lake development
At least five years working with Microsoft SQL Server DBMS
At least three years working with Microsoft Business Intelligence software; SSIS, SSAS, SSRS
At least three years demonstrated experience performing data analysis
At least three years demonstrated knowledge with complex T-SQL, including stored procedures, nested queries, and data transformation.
Experience in data warehouse concepts, including dimensional modelling and design
Experience with Tableau software would be an asset
Experience with Bitbucket software would be an asset
Experience with AWS-based technologies such as S3, Glue, Lambda, Lake Formation, CloudFormation, EMR, Athena, RDS, Redshift would be an asset
Experience with data and event stream processing using Kafka/ksqlDB would be an asset
Experience with modern programming languages (Python, Java, Scala, C#, etc.) would be an asset
Ability to design and implement innovative yet practical solutions to Business Intelligence problems
Knowledgeable of software design and development lifecycle, DevOps, and Agile development practices
Ability to conceptualize applications from both a technical/programming perspective and a business point of view.
A proven ability to identify core business requirements from more general discussion and ability to translate these into technical requirements and specifications.
Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal and written skills in English.
Ability to identify issues that pose risks to the success of initiatives.
The ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment
The ability to communicate business concepts effectively to technical staff
The ability to communicate technical concepts and information effectively to non-technical staff
A proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
A strong work ethic without sacrificing your sense of humour or your ability to have fun on the job.

Education & Experience:
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Additional education, training or membership to organizations relevant to data management, information technology or other related fields would be an asset

Occasional on-call availability. Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines.

Job_Summary: Uncovers and documents data lineages and transformations across source systems and into data reporting repositories and improves the reliability and accuracy of…
Job_Description:
We’re looking for a spectacular Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team, to work across all business areas at Unbounce (Revenue, Product, and Operations). You’d support data-driven decision-making and ensure that high quality data is available for the organization’s consumption.
Our goal in our team is to use decision science to move the business towards a unified strategy, in a way that minimizes time spent on low-impact analysis and maximizes high-impact, data-driven decisions. The team strives to aid all business departments in their quest to create world-class customer products, and to increase market value for the business. The Data & Analytics team uses a combination of statistics, analysis and business intelligence, machine learning, and data science to answer business questions and deliver insight and recommendations for internal stakeholders.
The Analyst, Data Governance will develop, support and continually improve a data governance program, and identify and address priority data quality issues. They will enhance data management practices throughout the data lifecycle and are instrumental in improving the reliability of our data assets.

What You'll be Doing:
Work as a data analyst to provide information and insights to our stakeholders.
Proactively work with stakeholders to formulate and manage business questions, hypotheses, and specifications.
Contribute to the development and day-to-day operations of a data governance program and support data stakeholders including Data Governance Working Groups
Uncovers and documents data lineages and transformations across source systems and into data reporting repositories and improves the reliability and accuracy of data assets
Proactively elicits data quality issues, identifying and documenting root causes and recommendations to promote data accuracy across the organisation.
Work as an integral part of our ‘Data Analyst Chapter’ and Data Organization by contributing to the overall data ecosystem and improving data literacy throughout Unbounce
Help identify, define and build metrics and KPIs that lead to actionable results
Instrument applications with user tracking analytics to gain insight into the customer journey and how our product features are being used
Communicate complex quantitative data stories in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Breakdown stakeholder asks and suggest solutions based on timeliness, accuracy, business value, and impact
Be comfortable being the ‘go-to’ data person for your projects
Stay up to date on industry standards and best practices in data analytics
Own building hypotheses, scoping, running and conducting post analysis of experiments & A/B tests

A Little Bit About You
You have 2+ years working as an analyst, with a proven track record of generating research and analysis in a repeatable and actionable manner
You excel at working with non-technical stakeholders to help translate, manage and drive business needs into actionable insights
You’re familiar with project management, or have worked with a scrum master/product owner: managing and prioritizing tasks across teams (we use agile ceremonies, and JIRA to track our work), knowing who to loop in when, and providing timely updates to your stakeholders
You have a great working understanding of data governance practices and ideas of how to improve data literacy for non technical audiences
You have a working knowledge of data modelling, warehousing, and pipelining. We currently use Airflow to schedule our jobs
You are comfortable with SQL (we use mySQL and Postgres dialects) (experience using Python would be a bonus)
You are an expert data storyteller and have experience with a set of tools to enable that.

What’s in it for You:
A remote friendly office with flexible hours - for this role we will consider all applications from those based in Canada with the option to work from our Vancouver office
4 weeks vacation plus Christmas Holiday Closure - you're entitled to the week of Christmas off with pay through to and including Jan 1st
Vacation bonus - $1,000.00
12 Personal Wellness Days (This includes: Personal day, Moving day, Sick day, etc)
Health and Wellness budget - $500.00
Networking budget - $500.00
A paid day off for your birthday
One paid Volunteer day per year
One day every 2 weeks of dedicated professional development time

Unbounce Welcomes Everyone to Apply
At Unbounce we celebrate everyone and their multiple intersecting identities. We believe a panorama of experience allows us to make better decisions together and inspires innovation so that we can better serve our customers and community. Our goal is for every Unbouncer to feel deeply connected to their team through mutual value, respect, and understanding.
Please let us know if you require any accommodations or support during the recruitment process
Powered by JazzHR

We walk side-by-side with each of our business partners, solution resellers, and of course teams, as we collaborate in continue moving towards unprecedented levels of success, and this, worldwide.We did this by maintaining a warm familial environment, while always staying at the forefront of the industry, growing the team to nearly 80 astounding individuals. Job_Summary:
Support additional data auditing and workflow specifications associated to data integrity.
Compiling data, verifying accuracy and sorting information to prepare…
Job_Description:
About Us :

Established over 30 years ago, Medcan is a global leader in assessing clients' overall well-being and inspiring them to live well. Medcan has a comprehensive range of diagnostic assessments, which, in combination with innovative programs tailored to specific needs, are designed to successfully reach improved health outcomes.
Over 80 physicians and specialists, alongside a broad roster of complementary health care disciplines, provide health and lifestyle management services on site and by video consult for individuals, families and organizations. Our team of 550 staff see clients physically and virtually from our downtown Toronto location.
The Role
The Data Analyst is accountable for supporting Medcan’s data cleansing and data migration efforts. The key outcome is to have reliable data and data integrity to apply to our new infrastructure and systems.
The candidate will play a key role in supporting the development of the newly redesigned data architecture, data validation, ensuring the appropriate data points are available for reporting, and supporting the development team in readying data for system loads.
The Accountabilities
Entering data into system [Salesforce] based off revised data model and new business requests in an accurate and timely manner
Identify and support fixes to structural errors, data parsing, transformation, and duplicate elimination
Entering customer and account data from source documents – referencing legacy systems and new systems for validation and verification as well as identifying areas of missing data
Compiling data, verifying accuracy and sorting information to prepare source data for entry
Ability to validate/ challenge data model and requests. Ability to have conversations focused on verification with key business stakeholders
Support additional data auditing and workflow specifications associated to data integrity
Assist in other data entry, data-cleansing duties as required and requested
Connect and collaborate with Analytics team to ensure data sources for reporting requirements available and accurate
Keep information confidential. Comply with data integrity and security policies
The Requirements
1+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role
Ability to QA data (post-processing and additional cleansing processes), fix structural errors and data integrity issues.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in fast-paced environment and on project with tight delivery windows
Well versed in Microsoft Excel and data programs, experience using Salesforce is a plus
Ability to learn new systems quickly
Self-sufficient individual with the ability to work well in cross-functional teams
This is a short-term full-time contract opportunity. Preference will be given to those able to start immediately.
In your cover letter please include why you wish to align yourself with Medcan and how you believe you can add value to our organization.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an initial interview will be contacted. No phone calls and no agencies please.

Job_Summary: Have extensive experience with pharmaceutical data: syndicated/secondary data (IQVIA, HPA etc.), promotional & marketing data, longitudinal patient-level data…
Job_Description:
Imagine working for an organisation that focuses on putting people at the heart of what they do. Where every single person within the organisation is aligned to one main motivating force, that at the centre of everything they do, and their number one priority; are patients. A place that gives every individual the autonomy and empowerment to make a difference, where you are not defined by a job title. Imagine waking up every morning feeling fulfilled, having purpose and meaning in your work.
Imagine you are at Roche.
We are a pioneer in pharmaceuticals, advancing science to help people in the UK live longer and healthier lives. For over 120 years we have created truly differentiated medicines for cancer, the immune system, infectious diseases, ophthalmology and diseases of the central nervous system.
We work from bench to bedside - researching new medicines, running global clinical trials, and collaborating with the NHS to try to ensure rapid uptake and delivery of our products and services. Our drive, every day, is to ensure our medicines reach those who need them as soon as possible.
None of this would be possible without our extraordinary employees; our people make our business. We offer inspirational opportunities for employees that are as unique as they are. We have created an inclusive, respectful work environment where people can be authentic and truly invested in their work, a place to belong. Our outstanding commitment to workplace engagement has recently been recognised by our inclusion at number four on the Sunday Times Top 25 Best Big Companies to Work
Data & Analytics Partner

We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced and exceptional Data & Analytics Partner to join the Strategic Finance and Insights team (SFI). The SFI team are strategic thought partners that generate integrated, customer-centric insights to enable data-driven decision making that ultimately help deliver better outcomes for more patients, faster.
The Data & Analytics Partner plays a critical role as an “Analytics Translator” in bridging the enterprise technical expertise of data engineers and data scientists with the SFI team and broader UK affiliate functions. In doing so, the Data & Analytics Partner helps the organisation unlock the value from data assets to generate insights addressing business critical issues and opportunities.
The Data & Analytics Partner is responsible for:

Identifying and prioritising business use cases that analytics is best suited to solve
Identifying, procuring and guiding the integration of data needed to produce useful insights
Synthesizing complex analytics into easy-to-understand, actionable insights for business users
Driving adoption of analytics solutions among business users
Seeking opportunities to partner and collaborate with local and global networks of data and system experts (e.g. Pharma Informatics, Global Product Strategy, other affiliates), as well as external data providers to develop state-of-the-art analytical capabilities whilst removing silos and duplication, ensuring efficient use of similar skill-sets
Acting as a guardian for high standards of compliance, ethics and safety; putting patients at the centre of all actions by consistent business behaviour that complies with applicable laws, industry codes and Roche’s Code of Conduct.
Owning their development to ensure they are continually growing skills and capabilities in line with their passion and the needs of the Organisation

Individuals should
Have a Bachelors in Data Science, Statistics, or related degree, Masters/PhD preferred
Have e xceptional structured problem-solving and strategic agility abilities. S implifying complex information into clear, synthesized insights and presenting them to stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Leadership and influence in local and global networks
Have extensive experience with pharmaceutical data: syndicated/secondary data (IQVIA, HPA etc.), promotional & marketing data, longitudinal patient-level data and payer data
Be experienced in managing analytics projects with understanding of common pitfalls and evidence of delivering projects from ideation stage through to production and user adoption
Be proficient in interpreting quantitative model results to identify potential errors.
Be proficient with analytical and data visualisation tools (R, Python, Tableau)
Be comfortable collaborating in self-managed, cross-functional teams

At Roche, it is more than just a job. It’s a responsibility. A big one. If you really know yourself and want to be part of our international family, dedicated to making a real impact on the world around us, the next step is yours, apply above and join us on our transformational journey.
Closing date for applications: 15th November 2020
We are currently exploring geographic flexibility with all roles in our new operating model. While it may not be possible in some cases, we encourage you not to let the location define your decision to apply.
Roche Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, disability or age. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche Products Ltd
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Finance, Finance > Financial Planning and Analysis

Job_Summary:
You’ve spent 5+ years working in a data engineering role of some sort.
And you have a track record of obtaining requirements, designing, building, implementing,…
Job_Description:
Wanted: An ambuition Data Engineer who will help us better understand our customers

PN is looking for an experienced database engineer who’s passionate about health, fitness and helping people live their best life.

Precision Nutrition is growing, and we need a team-oriented, inquisitive engineer who will help us improve our database management and build a better product. As one of the largest nutrition coaching companies in the world, PN is bigger than it’s ever been — and it’s about to get bigger.


To help us scale, we need a motivated, approachable jack-of-all-trades who knows how to work with stakeholders and users to gather requirements, design ETL and API processes, and take part in execution and QA so we can do what we do best: help millions more people live healthier, happier lives.

Join our Adventure

We’re embarking on a new adventure, and we need a multi-talented engineer to improve our database management

We’ve got an exciting journey ahead of us… Over the next 10 years, Precision Nutrition will be expanding its world-class education and coaching services into a wide range of new fields, including yoga, group exercise, sports coaching, athletics, manual therapy and more. To help us reach our goals and keep us moving forward, we need a data engineer who knows how to build the pipe end to end—from requirements collection to post-rollout support and QA.


Who we’re looking for

A collaborative self-starter, with a keen attention to detail

You know the tools of the trade. You have a solid understanding of data warehousing tools and technology like Snowflake, as well as ETL tools like FiveTran and DBT. You’re experienced with reporting tools such as Tableau, and you can manipulate and analyze data in Python and SQL like a pro. Other similar tools like Heap, Google Analytics, Stripe, and Salesforce are a plus too.


You’re self-motivated. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don’t need a lot of direction. You have strong self-structure and discipline and have worked remotely either currently or in the past so you know the benefits and the challenges. At the same time, you don’t silo yourself, and are always eager to learn more and share with the team.


You like variety. Not only will you be handling all kinds of systems, apps, and technologies — like the tools mentioned above—but you’ll need to help with execution, QA, and other aspects of our database management. You relish new challenges and get excited by the prospect of wearing multiple hats.


You’re flexible. You have the ability to prioritize and re-prioritize your work in a changing environment. You understand that things change as new information is made available, and can flip from one project to another at the drop of a hat when your attention is needed.


You’re a stickler for the details. You are careful, cautious and incredibly meticulous. Some may even call you nitpicky (in an endearing way, of course). You can spot the smallest mistake before it throws a database off course. Nothing slips by the net when you're the goalie.


You work well with others. You aren’t just here to take orders—you’re an expert in your field who knows how to take charge without shutting others out of the process. You can take ideas from multiple sources and synthesize them into a clear course of action—and then execute it with aplomb.


You’re an exceptional communicator. You know how to get your message across clearly and concisely. You know how to say it, write it and present it in both layman’s terms and a bit more formally if needed. You know how to be heard and energize people around you no matter who you are interacting with, and you’re quick to respond when someone needs your help.


You’re adaptable. You’re comfortable working with cross-functional teams, and you can switch gears as smoothly as a Formula 1 driver. You may be working on requirements gathering one day, and doing support and exception handling another, and you relish the idea of taking ownership of the entire data pipeline.

What you’ll be doing

Learning the company’s data needs...

You’ll work with people across the company to assess what data we need to gather. That means:


Interviewing stakeholders, the analytics team, and users. From those people, you’ll gather requirements for data marts that the marketing, client care, and finance teams can use to better understand our customers.
Optimizing the process. You’ll review our existing requirements gathering process, make it better, and design and develop new processes for doing so on future projects.


...and turning that into action

You’ll then build the data model structure and support it from end to end. That includes:


Designing the process. You’ll develop the ETL processes, leveraging existing APIs or working with the tech team to build new ones.
Build and document everything. You’ll build, test, and fine-tune the entire data warehouse, and create detailed documentation so our team isn’t lost when you aren’t around.
Gather feedback and enter support mode. Your job isn’t done once the process is rolled out—you’ll also design new QA, security, privacy, and exception handling procedures, not to mention collect a backlog of enhancement requests and plan out the next release while working on other projects.


A few important caveats

This is a dream job, if you’re the right person for it.

Must-Have #1: You must be experienced.

You’ve spent 5+ years working in a data engineering role of some sort. You’re familiar with some or all of the following: registration and user behavior data, digital marketing information, customer support systems, and survey responses. And you have a track record of obtaining requirements, designing, building, implementing, and supporting ETL processes, dimensional data models, and data repositories for business intelligence and analytics purposes.

Must-Have #2: You must be results-oriented.

You know how to work with others and pay attention to the details—without getting slowed down by either. You know when to take more time and you know when it’s time to move full throttle and get things done. You aren’t satisfied until you’ve seen a project through to completion.


Must-Have #3: You thrive on collaboration.

You’re a self-starter, but you know that great things aren’t built by just one person. You don’t just play nicely with others, you excel at it—instead of being told what to do, you want to meld minds with your coworkers, bring out their best ideas, and build something truly awesome.


Wondering if this is the right path for you?

Every year, professionals at the top of their field choose to join Precision Nutrition.

Here are six reasons why.

Reason #1: We give you the freedom to “do you.”

Unlike most companies, we don’t have rigid rules about how and when to do things. You’ll always be free to work independently, whenever, wherever, and however you want.

Reason #2: You can work from anywhere.

We’re a 100% remote company, and have been working remote for 17 years. When you join our team, you’re no longer shackled to one desk, one office, one city, or even one country!

Reason #3: Meetings are optional. (No, really.)

You’re an adult. You’re capable of deciding how your time should be spent. If you don’t think you need to attend a meeting, you don’t. Simple as that.

Reason #4: You’ll always feel supported.

In a regular office, it’s easy to feel like a hamster in a wheel, powerless to change things. At Precision Nutrition, we work as a team to overcome issues & barriers that stand in each other’s way, and we treat each other with enthusiasm, compassion, and care.

Reason #5: You’ll never be bored.

People often come to Precision Nutrition after hitting a plateau in their old jobs. At PN, you’ll get the chance to conquer new challenges, learn from the best, and reach thrilling new heights of personal and professional growth.


Reason #6: You’re free to be you.


At Precision Nutrition, we want everyone to live healthier, happier lives—no matter your race, age, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. That's why diversity is a key ingredient of our workforce, so we can best represent the people we serve. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, we want our employees to bring their authentic whole selves to work. Be you.


Sound like we might just be the perfect company for you? Then you might just be the perfect fit for us. Click Apply for this Job below to get started!

Job_Title: Data Center Technician / Technicien de centre de données
Job_Summary: The Data Center Technician reports to the facility manager and is responsible for daily physical operations of the data centers in the Montreal region.
Job_Description:
(La version française suit la version anglaise)

Overview

The Data Center Technician reports to the facility manager and is responsible for daily physical operations of the data centers in the Montreal region. Responsibilities include deployment of new customer solutions, inventory and security control. Ensuring processes are adhered to, best practices identified & deployed. We are looking for candidates that have initiative, a continuous improvement mindset with great customer facing skills.

40-hour work week. Shift work required. Frequency to be discussed with manager based on business requirements.

We also accept candidates with experience.

Duties and Responsibilities


Deploy customer IT solutions in white spaces.
Ensure physical and remote security policies and procedures are being followed.
Document changes or incidents following the change or incident management process.
Perform scheduled walkthroughs and report any issues to the facility manager.
Troubleshoot and resolve basic OS and network level issues.
Answer customer requests in a professional and courteous manner.
Install, test copper & fiber cabling with quality.
Maintain an updated inventory of assets.
Manage the security access system.
Assist in documenting best practices & process improvements.
Special projects may be assigned.


Skills


Organized & Motivated
Strong Communication & Interpersonal skills
Aptitude to learn new technologies & trends
Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment
Ability to lift 60lbs on occasion


Knowledge


Knowledge of IT equipment and cabling installation best practices
Basic knowledge of Data Center Mechanical & Electrical systems an asset
Basic knowledge of Access Control Systems an asset
Basic knowledge of BICSI & TIA standards an asset
Bilingual (English & French)


All offers are contingent upon the successful completion and satisfactory results of a background investigation.

****

Vue d'ensemble

Le technicien de centre de données relève du gestionnaire des installations et est responsable des opérations physiques quotidiennes des centres de données de la région de Montréal. Les responsabilités incluent le déploiement de nouvelles solutions client, l'inventaire et le contrôle de la sécurité. S'assurer que les processus sont respectés, les meilleures pratiques identifiées et déployées. Nous recherchons des candidats qui ont de l’initiative, une mentalité d’amélioration continue et d’excellentes compétences en matière de relation client.

Semaine de travail de 40 heures. Travail sur des quarts requis. La fréquence sera à discuter avec le responsable en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise.

Nous acceptons également les candidats avec expérience.

Responsabilités


Déployer les solutions informatiques des clients dans des espaces blancs.
S’assurer les stratégies et procédures de sécurité physiques et à distance sont suivies.
Documenter les changements ou les incidents après la gestion du changement ou le processus de gestion d'incidents.
Effectuer des procédures pas à pas programmées et signaler tout problème au responsable de l'installation.
Localiser et résoudre les problèmes de base liés au système d'exploitation et au réseau.
Répondre aux demandes des clients de manière professionnelle et courtoise.
Installer et tester le câblage cuivre et fibre optique avec précision.
Maintenir un inventaire actualisé des actifs.
Gérer le système d'accès sécurisé.
Participer à la documentation des meilleures pratiques et des améliorations de processus.
Des projets spéciaux peuvent être assignés.


Compétences


Organisé et motivé
Solides compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles
Aptitude à apprendre de nouvelles technologies et tendances
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement en évolution rapide
Capacité de soulever 60 lb à l'occasion


Connaissances

Connaissance de base des systèmes mécaniques et électriques de centres de données, un atout
Connaissance de base des systèmes de contrôle d'accès, un atout
Connaissance de base des normes BICSI & TIA, un atout
Bilingue (anglais et français)

Job_Summary: Effectively communicate customer needs and priorities for project planning, development, implementation, maintenance and support.
Job_Description:
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Data Developer Intern

Job Description
WHY LOBLAW?
The Loblaw Supply Chain is the heart of our business and is committed to making customers our number one priority. As a member of our dynamic Supply Chain network, you will play a role in ensuring our product – nearly 1billion units of it – makes its way from one of our 3,000 vendors, through one of our 27 distribution centers, to one of our 2,300 locations across Canada, and into the homes of millions of Canadians each year. How’s that for a challenge?
WHAT YOU’LL DO
 The candidate will be responsible for supporting the discovery, development and delivery of ongoing technological solutions to improve the competitive advantage of Loblaw through continuous business process improvements.
 Effectively communicate customer needs and priorities for project planning, development, implementation, maintenance and support.
 Research industry leading solutions and determining the feasibility of implementation in our Supply Chain network.
 Use initiative and critical thinking to deal with concerns/issues/roadblocks within projects.
 Maintains accountability and is focused on results.
 Focuses on opportunities to improve and streamline user experiences with software & hardware.
 Ensure in-depth analyses of business issues and project results are presented in a clear and concise format.
 Analyze, clarify and present the technical components of business issues/needs in a clear and concise format and in a professional, diplomatic and timely fashion.
 Excellent grasp of business process and operational workflow modeling.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED
Working towards an undergraduate degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or related fields.
Exceptional Microsoft Office skills, including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, with the ability to manipulate data, construct graphical reports, flowcharts and basic functions.
Knowledge of SQL and Python are an asset but not required
Ability to think through a problem and determine the appropriate solution based upon Supply Chain principles, logic and common sense.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Be able to handle multiple tasks at the same time and be able to re-prioritize effectively.
Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Basic knowledge of Supply Chain concepts in an asset
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Temporary (Fixed Term)
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Job_Summary: Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS data…
Job_Description:
BusPatrouille :

Notre mission est de responsabiliser et de sensibiliser les usagers de la route. Nous nous consacrons à rendre le trajet entre la maison et l'école plus sûr. Nous développons des partenariats, nous déployons une technologie de sécurité et nous gérons tous les aspects du programme. Nous avons déjà équipé des milliers d'autobus scolaires en Amérique du Nord avec notre technologie innovante et nous continuons d'éduquer chaque mois des dizaines de milliers de conducteurs quant à la sécurité routière. La sécurité des élèves est au cœur des préoccupations de BusPatrouille. Nous éduquons les automobilistes jour après jour en aidant à faire respecter la loi et nous travaillons avec les responsables des écoles pour améliorer la sécurité.


Offre d'emploi :

L'ingénieur·e de données de BusPatrouille travaillera à structurer, modéliser et automatiser tous les flux de données dans notre architecture sur AWS, en mettant l'accent sur l'optimisation, l'intégrité et la sécurité. Dans le cadre de ses fonctions, l'ingénieur·e de données travaillera énormément avec les différentes parties prenantes et sera un pivot en ce qui a trait à tous les besoins techniques du service de veille stratégique afin de développer des algorithmes permettant de rendre les données brutes plus utiles à l'entreprise.


Votre rôle :

Créer et tenir à jour une architecture optimale du pipeline de données.
Assembler de grands ensembles de données complexes qui répondent aux exigences tant fonctionnelles que non fonctionnelles de l'entreprise.
Définir, concevoir et mettre en œuvre les améliorations possibles des processus internes : automatisation des processus manuels, optimisation de la transmission des données, reconception de l'infrastructure en vue d'une plus grande évolutivité.
Construire l'infrastructure requise pour optimiser l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement de données provenant d'une grande variété de sources de données en utilisant les technologies de données SQL et AWS.
Assurer la séparation et la sécurité transfrontalières de nos données grâce aux régions AWS.
Créer des outils de données qui aident les membres des équipes scientifiques d'analyse et de données à concevoir et à optimiser nos produits.Travailler avec des spécialistes en matière de données et d'analyse pour obtenir une plus grande fonctionnalité de nos systèmes de données.

Profil recherché :

Baccalauréat ou maîtrise ès sciences en informatique ou dans un domaine technique connexe.
Plus de quatre années d'expérience dans la conception de schémas et la modélisation de données dimensionnelles.
Plus de cinq années de connaissances de SQL pour divers besoins en matière de rapports et de transformation (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift)
Expérience dans la conception et l'optimisation d'architectures de pipelines de données et d'ensembles de données structurées/non structurées.
Expérience pratique d'AWS Glue.Compréhension et connaissances techniques des services d'AWS (EC2, S3).
Aptitude à la communication verbale et non verbale : La communication est cruciale pour travailler avec une équipe et la diriger. Ce poste nécessite de communiquer avec son équipe, ses supérieur·e·s, les parties prenantes et les clients à l'externe. Un·e chef d'équipe communique de manière claire et efficace tout en donnant la direction à suivre.
Compétences organisationnelles : L'organisation est importante lorsque plusieurs membres d'une équipe travaillent sur un même projet. De solides compétences organisationnelles vous aideront à suivre la progression des projets et à entretenir la motivation des membres de l'équipe.
Capacité à déléguer : Les chefs d'équipe doivent déléguer des tâches à chaque membre de l'équipe. Pour cela, les chefs d'équipe doivent avoir confiance dans les capacités de l'équipe.
Intégrité : Les chefs d'équipe doivent donner l'exemple. Un·e chef d'équipe intègre a non seulement plus de chances de gagner la confiance des membres de son équipe, mais aussi d'être respecté·e et apprécié·e par l'équipe.
Éthique de travail basée sur la confiance : Les membres d'une équipe imitent souvent l'éthique de travail de leur chef d'équipe. Faire preuve de confiance envers l'équipe et sa tâche contribue à inspirer confiance aux membres de l'équipe.
Parler couramment l'anglais et le français.

Ce que nous offrons

L'occasion de contribuer à la création d'une entreprise vouée à la sécurité des enfants.
La chance d'intégrer une équipe innovante et dévouée, spécialisée dans les technologies de pointe.
Un salaire et un ensemble d'avantages sociaux compétitifs.

Nous sommes à la recherche de membres essentiels de l'équipe de BusPatrouille qui nous aideront dans notre quête pour accroître la sécurité des enfants. Ce poste joue un rôle important dans notre entreprise et constitue une formidable opportunité pour les candidat·e·s qui seront choisi·e·s. Nous offrons un milieu de travail inclusif, diversifié, enthousiaste, intègre et profondément engagé. Venez nous aider à assurer la sécurité des enfants.

Who we are:

Our mission is to create a culture of responsibility and awareness on the road. We are devoted to making the journey to and from school safer. We develop partnerships, deploy Safety Tech and manage the entire program. We have equipped thousands of buses across North America with our innovative technology and we continue to educate tens of thousands of drivers a month on safety. BusPatrol America cares about student safety. We educate motorists every day by helping to enforce the law and work with school officials to improve safety.

The Opportunity:

The data engineer at BusPatrol will work to structure, model, and automate all data flows into our AWS architecture, with a focus on optimization, integrity, and security. As part of the role, the Data Engineer will work immensely with stakeholders, and be a focal point of all technical needs of the BI department to develop algorithms to help make raw data more useful to the enterprise.

What we need you to do:

Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS data technologies.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through AWS regions
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Bilingual in English and French


What you bring:

BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
4+ years of experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling
5+ years of SQL knowledge for various reporting and transformation needs (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift)
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architecture, and structured/unstructured data sets
Hands on experience in AWS GlueUnderstanding and technical knowledge on AWS services (EC2, S3)
Verbal and nonverbal communication skills: Communication is crucial when working with and leading a team because you will have to communicate with your team, supervisors, stakeholders, and external customers.. A team leader communicates in a way that is clear, effective and directive.
Organizational skills: Organization is important when you have multiple team members working on one project. Strong organizational skills will help you monitor progress and keep team members motivated.
Ability to delegate: Team leaders must delegate tasks to individual team members. This requires the team leader to trust in the abilities of the team.
Integrity: Team leaders should lead by example. A team leader who has integrity is not only more likely to be trusted by their team members, but also will often be respected and appreciated by the team.
Confident work ethic: Team members often mimic the work ethic of the team leader. Displaying confidence in the task and the team itself can help to instill confidence in team members.

What we offer:

An opportunity to help build a company dedicated to children's safety
The chance to join an innovative and dedicated team, focused on leading edge technology
Competitive salary and benefits package

We are looking for critical members of the BusPatrol team to assist us in our quest to improve children's safety. This is an important role for us and a great opportunity for the right candidates. Our environment is inclusive, diverse, ignited, built on integrity and deeply committed. Come and help us keep our children safe.

Job_Title: Program Lead, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO)
Job_Summary: Responsible for defining and implementing an enterprise-level vision and strategy to enhance data and information governance as well as master data capabilities…
Job_Description:
Program Lead, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO)


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
Generous vacation days
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program


Why is this role important?
The Program Lead, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO) is part of a matrix team

responsible for defining and implementing an enterprise-level vision and strategy to enhance data and information governance as well as master data capabilities for operational, analytical and reporting needs with a focus on key master data domains (e.g. geography, population, organization, and client).


This position will also lead work related to establishing standards for and enhancements to master and reference data. They may supervise analytical staff who are tasked with performing operational, coordination and analytical activities on CIHI’s master data. These analytical staff will also provide education, coordination and support to internal users of the data.

This position will have a focus on the core operational activities of the department including: standards development and implementation, leadership in the client steward domain, support for components of the data and information governance program of work and support for master data operational activities.


What you'll do
1. Facilitates discussion with representatives across the organization on corporate standards, policies and procedures related to data and information governance in order to build a comprehensive corporate data governance program. Obtains support and approval through proper governance channels, while interfacing with staff at all levels of the organization.

2. Applies analytical and problem solving skills to the redesign of data management business processes and the information systems that support them. Understands change management best practices and can apply them to gain buy in from stakeholders. Works closely with technical resources (Architects, BSA, Technical Lead, Developers, QA) to understand current state of data, processes and procedures for management of data and information.
3. Leads the planning and execution for components of CIHI’s data governance and standards program. Responsible for the creation, and assignment of work plans, definition of tasks and milestones, resource planning, overall project scheduling, monitoring, issue resolution and reporting progress to the team. Provides regular progress reports, manages resources, identifies issues, priorities and risks and makes recommendations to the manager.

4. Be knowledgeable about the CIHI data governance program and CIHI master and reference data by providing expertise and guidance to CIHI business staff and projects. Leverages industry standards, best practices to ensure services provided are documented, and that access to CIHI products and services are compliant with CIHI’s security, privacy and confidentiality policies, programs and guidelines.

5. Provides leadership and guidance to staff. Supervises, motivates, coaches, coordinates and monitors work, workload and performance of staff to ensure that quality is maintained and that learning opportunities are provided. Conducts annual performance management reviews. Assists in recruiting qualified staff and providing orientation and training to the assigned portfolio.
6. Assists the Manager in the department’s budget, strategic and operational planning and monitors progress against the approved plan.

7. Facilitates close collaboration between the broader DGSO department and other CIHI teams to plan and implement enhancements and harmonization of products, services and business processes to meet rapidly growing and evolving client needs. Ensures coordinated planning and execution of deliverables as well as matrix management of staff involved in cross-functional activities.
8. Participates in relevant corporate initiatives such as data dictionary, organizational index, and identity management. Participation includes, but is not limited to, promoting their effective use corporate-wide by demonstrating practical value in daily business operations, preparing briefing notes and making presentations to internal and external stakeholders as needed.


What you'll bring to the table
An undergraduate degree in health sciences, business/health administration, health information, social science or an equivalent scientific or clinical discipline is required. Graduate degree is an asset.
A minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in a health information or health-related field, including providing client support, team leadership, data management and a demonstrated experience in management with an ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with minimal supervision.

Experience with CIHI databases, indicator methodology and business processes associated with developing and reporting on indicators using the CIHI master data (e.g. OI, geography, client linkage data) is an asset.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, presentation and facilitation skills

Excellent skills in internal and external collaboration and consensus building.

Team player with strong conceptual thinking, problem solving and decision making skills.
Demonstrated ability to innovate and independently identify opportunities for strategic growth and quality improvement.
Knowledge of CIHI’s data distribution business processes for both internal & external customers, data warehouse and business intelligence tool structure is an asset.
Ability to meet travel requirements.
Fluency in both official languages is strongly preferred.


Basic Qualifications
An undergraduate degree in health sciences, business/health administration, health information, social science or an equivalent scientific or clinical discipline is required. Graduate degree is an asset.
A minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in a health information or health-related field, including providing client support, team leadership, data management and a demonstrated experience in management


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Company: Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board
Job_Summary:
Knowledge and understanding of data quality standards, data equity, research ethics, privacy and data security.
35 hours/week- 12 months per year.
Job_Description:
RESEARCH ANALYST ASSISTANT(Temporary)

Start date: TBD

Salary: Category 1: $55, 709 - $64, 279/ year

35 hours/week- 12 months per year

Location: TBD

ALG Posting #20-014

Non-Union position

The Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board offers dynamic, high quality educational programs for nearly 33,000 elementary, secondary and adult students in the 100 schools within our jurisdiction.

All positions in the Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board support the schools priority of student achievement and the Board’s mission to educate our students to excel in learning, to succeed in life and to enrich our communities.

Employees demonstrate empathy and respect in all interactions, are committed to service excellence, and embrace change through innovation.


This is a 35 hour/week temporary one year contract position reporting to the Data, Research and Accountability Leader. This Non-Union position provides a challenging and satisfying assignment for a highly skilled and experienced employee.
The role of the Research Analyst Assistant is to provide support to the Research Department in researching, maintaining, analyzing, visualizing and reporting on data related to Ministry accountability requirements and the Board’s Strategic Plan.

This position reports directly to the Data, Research and Accountability Leader who reports to the System Principal of Teaching Learning.

Main Responsibilities:

Create, maintain, analyze and ensure the integrity and security of large data sets of excel-based education metrics for use by the Research Team, including, but not limited to, provincial assessment data such as EQAO data, identity-based data, and achievement data;
Contribute to the development of data analysis plans and development of new data sets for complex research projects and engage in exploratory data analysis;
Create data visualizations and write research reports for review and approval;
Use quality control checks, practices and tools that continuously improve the accuracy, rigor, efficiency and timeliness of analysis and reporting;
Support principles of ethics, equity, anti-racism and inclusionary practice;
Work collaboratively and independently ensuring project goals and timelines are met;
Participate in ongoing planning and review meetings taking direction from the Data, Research and Accountability Leader;
Other duties as assigned by the Data, Research and Accountability Leader.

Supervision:

does not supervise

Education & Experience Required:

Post-secondary degree completed in a social science, mathematics, epidemiology, or equivalent combination of education and data analytics experience with a strong focus on data management, research methods, analysis and reporting, such as a Research Analyst post-grad certificate.
One to two years of related experience working in a progressive environment (School Board or other education environment is preferred).


Specialized skills Required:

The emphasis for this position is data management and analytics requiring fluency with related software such as Power Query and other advanced functions of MS Excel. Knowledge of R, Python and Power BI considered an asset.
Demonstrated data analytics skills, such as the expertise to clean, transform, mine, integrate and translate complex data sets in a timely way with the highest standards of accuracy.
Outstanding ability to communicate complex research and statistical concepts to varying stakeholders, including excellent report writing skills.
Data Visualization skills to develop engaging visualizations (such as graphs, infographics), dashboards or other creative means of communication. Creative skills to propose new ways to represent and visualize analytics results to various stakeholder audiences.
Proficiency with statistics software for both descriptive and inferential statistics.
Knowledge of social science research methods (both quantitative and qualitative).
Knowledge and understanding of data quality standards, data equity, research ethics, privacy and data security.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the time management skills to meet deadlines.
Excellent interpersonal, consultation, and oral/written communication skills.
A professional who works well independently as well as collaboratively as part of a team.
Share our passion for the value of education statistics to inform practice and improve outcomes for students in the board’s jurisdiction.
Valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle.

A police records check, with a Vulnerable Sector Search and Pardoned Sexual Offenders Database Search, dated within 6 months prior to the date of hire, is a requirement for employment with this Board. Please note that there have been reports that it has taken some candidates up to 6 weeks to obtain a police check. With that in mind, we strongly recommend that you go about obtaining this search at your earliest convenience.

Job_Summary: You will be responsible to maintain data accuractu of the data warehouse by implementing quality control measures, define and document best practices to reduce…
Job_Description:
The Role
You are passionate about consumer products, consumer trends and digital products and you are a result-oriented professional. You are a product builder, who loves solving challenging problems and delivering powerful analysis that will help Moka reach new levels. We are looking for specialists who want to work on cutting-edge technologies, be part of a team behind one of the most popular Fintech apps in Canada, bring fresh ideas and want to see them come to life. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will work with the Marketing team critical to Moka's needs and have opportunities to develop your skills.
You will develop a deep understanding of all the data sources used by the team, perform effective data quality analysis, validation and troubleshooting. You will be responsible to maintain data accuractu of the data warehouse by implementing quality control measures, define and document best practices to reduce and resolve data anomalies. You will be highly involved in defining Consumer data governance rules, as well as assist in reporting, dashboard creation and participate in the development and implementation of new marketing initiatives involving Consumer Data.
Interested? We are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics and who demonstrates a willingness to go the extra mile, takes on the responsibility of doing what needs to be done, has a positive attitude and rolls with changes. This person will have a great opportunity to join a committed and talented team of data enthusiasts.
What You'll Be Doing
Ensure the accuracy of key funnel metrics and support marketing decisions by providing comprehensive reporting and analysis of data;
Support the Moka Executive team, Marketing team and BI team in a multitude of data related tasks including reporting, data extractions and data validation; Develop, monitor and maintain dashboards to help support the business;
Ensure appropriate monitoring and alerting is present to inform the team of unexpected variances in trends
Analyze current data to provide business units with additional insights on donors, their giving history and where possible, provide predictive statistics;
Mining and analyzing data from company's databases to make conclusions on how to make optimizations in company's product development and business strategies;
Frame problems then determine intended approaches and quantitative methods to develop solutions;
Use analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, developing actionable insights using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, profiling and segmentation analysis, and data mining;
Receive short- and mid-term assignments that require the use of independent judgment outside of established procedures;
Skills
2+ years of relevant experience
Degree in marketing or business
Experience with data manipulation skills, especially using SQL language
Excellent problem-solving skills
Bonus Points
Experience with Tableau & Mixpanel or similar products
Meet Moka
Moka is on a mission to help Canadians achieve their financial goals. The Moka app makes it easy for everyone to save by automatically rounding up their purchases and investing the spare change, but roundups are just the beginning. To help our users across all aspects of their financial lives, we use data to develop personalized insights, recommendations and services. Now, we are looking for more great people who want to be part of a high-energy startup reshaping the financial services industry. If you want to work with talented people, solve big problems and make life better for hundreds of thousands of people, in Canada and beyond, come join us at Moka.
Why Moka?
Moka is Canada's fastest growing fintech, and we're just getting started. Since launching in July 2017, Moka has been downloaded over 750,000 times and has helped Canadians save and invest, many for the very first time.
We've been featured in major media (https://mylo.ai/press/) across the country, won a deal on Dragons' Den, and acquired an asset management firm with over $120M AUM. Our CEO Phil Barrar was nominated for EY Entrepreneur of the Year, made the Bay St Bull's 30<30 List, and has raised $14M in funding to date, most notably from NAVentures, the venture capital division of National Bank of Canada and Desjardins Capital, the venture capital arm of North America's largest association of credit unions.
What We Offer
In a short time, our team has grown from just a few to more than 50 people. At Moka, we value making an impact, asking the tough questions and being inclusive. Our people and their passion are what truly set us apart.
Open-concept offices in St-Henri (dogs are welcome!) with snacks and coffee provided
Comprehensive health benefits package including remote care and extras like subsidized metro/bus pass
Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location
Support for continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals
Team activities and get-togethers like game night and our annual holiday chalet getaway
A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people
We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
